div.bibl: RADNICKA STRAZA Vol. III, No. 20, May 6, 1910 MAY FIRST IN CHICAGO

body.p: The celebration of First of May in Chicago was more magnificent than ever this year. A out 20,000 workers attended the parade, which moved through the streets on the West Side of the city. Under red banner and revolutionary signs workers of different nationalities in Chicago assembled to demonstrate for their rights on the streets.
The celebration ended in Pilsen Park, where stands were built, from which speakers, from all nationalities spoke about the importance and significance of said great holiday of the workers.
Serbs, Croats, Slovens and Bulgars were present at the parade in respectable numbers.
